articles.headline: "Revolutionizing Crop Resilience: How This Study Could Feed the World in 2050"
articles.hook: Why should an undergrad care about this? If you’re studying biology, chemistry, or environmental science, this research shows how your classroom knowledge can directly tackle global food insecurity—by engineering crops that thrive in extreme climates.
articles.difficulty:
**Sophomore**: Needs intro-level major courses (organic, biochem, etc.)  
This research combines genetics, ecology, and data science—topics you’re just starting to explore in your sophomore year. While some concepts (like CRISPR) are advanced, the study’s focus on real-world applications ties directly to your coursework in biology, chemistry, and environmental science.

articles.headline: How Cover Crops Supercharge Soil Health: A Breakthrough for Sustainable Farming
articles.hook: If you're studying agriculture or environmental science, this research could reshape how you approach soil health and sustainable farming—without a single plow.
articles.difficulty: Sophomore (requires intro-level courses in agronomy, chemistry, and biology).
